Second time to stay in this hotel but I have to say there are better hotels in the city. Location was great for getting to the Messe Frankfurt (but still a short bus ride to the site). If it's warm definitely ask for a Ventilator (Fan) because their air conditioning does not compare to the states. My room overlooked the main street and it was a bit noisy. Tubs are extremely narrow and deep...careful! Staff was courteous but not overly friendly.

reviews.title: The worst business hotel I have ever stayed in

reviews.text: We have been staying at the Frankfurt Maritim for many years, and the service there has always been appalling. Its one merit is its proximity to the city's trade fair grounds, and it exploits this fact shamelessly. It's hard to know where to start with what's wrong here but this year was the worst ever and we have decided enough is enough.
reviews.title: At exhibition time appallingly overpriced

reviews.text: We always stay on the Superior (6th) Floor where the premium-priced rooms used to include Bulgari toiletries. A few years ago, as a cost saving measure, these were replaced with Maritim brand products which appear to be made in China, and are the sort of thing you expect at a Holiday Inn rather than a 400 Euro per night hotel. No decent hotel offers this low grade of product nowadays, and certainly not on a so-called Superior Floor.
reviews.title: Horrible Experience

reviews.text: The Superior Floor also includes a lounge with an honour bar, but you're lucky if you can ever find a seat. Guests staying on other floors are offered a pass to the lounge - at an extortionate price, of course - so the room, which seats 20 comfortably, is always jammed. Breakfast in the lounge is a shambles, with wait staff struggling to keep the very basic breakfast stocked. On our first morning this year, they had literally run out of everything, including coffee cups, eggs, and juice.

reviews.title: Best Location for Frankfurt Fair

reviews.text: I stayed for one night in this hotel while in Frankfurt. The front desk staff were pleasant and helpful. The room was spacious but I found the bed too soft and the bathroom had a lack of products (only shampoo and liquid soap provided, no conditioner or moisturiser). I was awoken at 8am by the housekeeper who openned the door checking if the room was empty. Breakfast was overpriced but was of high quality and of a good selection. In room internet was not wifi and cost 12 euros per day with no option for an hourly rate. I had a late flight so left my luggage in the hotel for the day. When returning to collect my luggage the front desk staff remembered my name but I did have to wait for 15 minutes to wait for a porter to collect my luggage. For the price this hotel is not worth the money.
reviews.title: Overpriced hotel and awoken at 8am by the housekeeper openning the door

reviews.text: Well, what to say to this kind of hotel. The hotel highlights on the website that the pool is closed but does not mention anything about the gym (so called sport center). I went there in the afternoon and was surprised to see that the gym is also closed for refurbishment. What a disappointment - but on top of that (when I entered the gym) the contractor yelled on me "get out, get out, get out". I felt like a cow chased from a field. What kind of behavior is this? Every two star hotel treats guests in a more polite way. Another issue is the security in the room. My door did not close properly and I told the housekeeper on the floor that there is a problem. She promised to send somebody from engineering, but nothing happen. After one hour waiting I called reception and asked for engineering to come to my room. The guy came instantly but decided to spray the door only instead of re-aligning it as I suggested to him. Of course the door still did not close properly and I had to slam the door heavily every time I entered or left the room, in order to get the door closed. Although the door was closed after I slammed it....it does not feel very safe to close a door like that. Later I learned that the guest in the room next to me had to close the door in the same way. Imagine the noise level and the affect on the door condition. In summary it was not worth spending all the money for being treated like a cow from a contractor and staying in a room and feeling insecure.
reviews.title: Misleading website statement
